personal.name: Steven Tung
personal.briefDescription: Computer Science student passionate about building innovative solutions. Pursuing BS/MS at Stony Brook University with experience in cloud and full-stack development.
personal.aboutMe: I'm a passionate computer science student with a strong foundation in software development and distributed systems. Currently pursuing both a Bachelor's and Master's degree in Computer Science at Stony Brook University, I thrive on solving complex problems and building scalable solutions.

projects.title: Distributed Banking System
projects.description: Created a fault-tolerant distributed banking system using Two-Phase Commit and Paxos consensus algorithm to ensure atomic transactions and data consistency across multiple clusters. As a bonus, also implemented a byzantine fault-tolerant project using PBFT.
highlights: Implemented a fault-tolerant distributed banking system, integrating Two-Phase Commit (2PC) for atomic transaction processing and Paxos consensus algorithm for coordinating operations across clusters, ensuring data consistency

Developed multi-cluster sharding with multiprocessing and gRPC communication, supporting concurrent transaction processing and dynamic resharding using hypergraph partitioning to reduce cross-shard operations

Built fault tolerance mechanisms including write-ahead logging (WAL), leader election, view change protocols, and automated recovery handling node failures and resumptions while maintaining ACID properties across accounts

Created performance monitoring and testing framework tracking throughput, latency metrics, and transaction success rates across distributed nodes, with interactive tools for analyzing system state and consensus protocol behavior

projects.title: Real Time Transit Tracker
projects.description: Developed a full-stack web application that provides real-time tracking of buses and trains using transit feeds, integrating a responsive frontend with a robust backend to deliver up-to-date transit information to users.
highlights: Developed a real-time bus and train tracker by utilizing transit feeds to provide users with automated up-to-date information related to vehicle locations, stop data, route information, and arrival times

Created a clean and responsive frontend using Tailwind CSS, allowing users to search, sort, and customize the presented information. Integrated map plotting to provide a visual representation of routes
Implemented backend services with Node.js and Express.js to handle API requests, process live feed data from multiple sources, manage user interactions, and store data in MongoDB
Ensured secure user authentication using JSON Web Tokens to manage user sessions and hashing to protect user data

projects.title: Electronic Medical Records Database
projects.description: Led the development of a custom Electronic Medical Records (EMR) system to digitize and organize patient records, improving accessibility and efficiency for clinical staff through automated document processing and user-friendly tools.
highlights: Led digitization and organization of patient records in a custom EMR system, consolidating thousands of clinical documents to streamline chart retrieval and reduce time-to-access for front-desk and clinical staff

Built and maintained automated document conversion and extraction processes to produce clean, consolidated patient summaries‚Äîimproving clinical chart prep and reducing manual data entry for intake and visit workflows

Managed user accounts, data integrity, and privacy-minded handling of patient information; created admin tools and staff-facing documentation to support onboarding and reduce record lookup errors during appointments

projects.title: Password Vault
projects.description: Developed a secure password manager which leverages AES encryption and SHA-256 hashing for safeguarding sensitive information. Users can utilize features such as adding, deleting, updating, or looking up password entries.
highlights: Built a secure password manager which leverages AES encryption and SHA-256 hashing for safeguarding sensitive information. Users can utilize features such as adding, deleting, updating, or looking up password entries
Uses scrypt for key derivation and nonce management, with validation to prevent brute-force attacks & ensure integrity

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Applied Mathematics and Statistics
Masters of Science in Computer Science

roles.description: Implemented a deduplication API for cross cloud file transfers in C# for secure government cloud systems.
responsibilities: Developed a high-performance file deduplication system using Redis cache and C#, reducing redundant cloud transfers and improving service efficiency in large-scale Azure environments
Gained hands-on experience with Microsoft‚Äôs internal tools and CI/CD pipelines, including automated testing, Azure cloud, and deployment monitoring

roles.description: Did data analysis and created data integration tools to support analytic operations.
responsibilities: Successfully developed and deployed robust software applications to support large-scale data processing and analytic operations, resulting in a significant reduction in triage and analysis time

Created data integration and analysis tools using Python to support cross-referencing between data sets, enhancing targeting and correlation capabilities, resulting in an increase in operational efficiency

Utilized unique and highly specialized data sets, as well as open-source data, statistical software packages, cloud services, and AI/ML technology to identify patterns and relationships in large volumes of data

courses.name: Computer Science Principles
courses.description: Introduces central ideas of computing and computer science, instills practices of algorithmic and computational thinking, and engages students in the creative aspects of the field. Also introduces appropriate computing technology as a means for solving computational problems and exploring creative endeavors. Includes weekly computer programming assignments, but assumes no previous programming experience.

courses.name: Data Structures
courses.description: Study of abstract data types including stacks, queues, lists, trees, and graphs. Implementation and analysis of algorithms.

courses.name: Finite Mathematical Structures
courses.description: Topics include sets, functions, relations, graphs, and combinatorics with applications to computer science.
